This close proximity may induce severe steric clashes causing the large loss of potency observed for 107 HsLTA4H inhibition. The active site residues are represented in line and the zinc ion is shown as grey 108 sphere. The key residues involved in HsLTA4H's S1 subsite modulation were represented in stick.

The catalytic zinc ion is shown as grey sphere. Residues involved in S1' plasticity are 121 shown in stick. In blue, residues which reduce the cavity width; in red, residues which 122 modulate the cavity depth. Images generated with KVFinder plugin in PyMOL.

PDB 4FYR (cyan, cavity volume 811.87 Å 3 ). In the "Phe-In" conformation, Phe896 is oriented into the 135 active site inducing a partial closing of the S1 subsite. The active site cavity was computed by
KVFinder. The flexible 891-998 loop was represented in cartoon and the key Phe896 residue involved 137 in S1 subsite modulation was represented in stick.

FIGREF6.text: Local movement of Met260 in the active site of EcPepN. (a) Surface representation of the 96 active site of EcPepN in complex with (a) aminobenzosuberone 21c (green, PDB 5MFS) and (b) 97 bestatin 1 (white, PDB 2DQM). (c) Superimposition of the protein backbone of EcPepN in complex 98 with aminobenzosuberone 21c (green, PDB 5MFS) and bestatin 1 (white, PDB 2DQM). The active site cavity was computed by KVFinder. The active site residues are represented in line and the zinc ion is 100shown as grey sphere. The shorter distance between 105 the oxygen atom of HsLTA4H Tyr378 and the aromatic core of aminobenzosuberone 21c was 1.2Å .

FIGREF7.text: Superimposition of the protein backbone of the aminobenzosuberone 21c in EcPepN 112 complex (green, PDB 5MFS) with different M1 aminopeptidases. HsAPN (cyan, PDB 4FYT), 113 HsERAP1 (orange, PDB 2YD0), HsERAP2 (yellow, PDB 4JBS), HsIRAP (white, PDB 5MJ6), PfAM1 114 (magenta, PDB 3EBH). The catalytic zinc ion is shown as grey sphere. The gatekeeper residue is 115 listed. Images generated with PyMOL.HsIRAP (white, PDB 5MJ6), EcPepN (green, PDB 5MFS), PfAM1 (magenta, PDB 3EBH).
